 ----
 
+=== Select date in date picker
+
+==== *_Info_*
+
+Selects a next or previous picker wheel value in date picker
+
+[WARNING]
+Supported only for `iOS` platform
+Picker wheel argument must be `XCUIElementTypePickerWheel`
+
+==== *_Wording_*
+
+[source,gherkin]
+----
+When I select $direction value in picker wheel located `$locator`
+----
+
+==== Properties
+
+* `mobile-application.date-picker.offset` - see `offset` argument from http://appium.io/docs/en/writing-running-appium/ios/ios-xctest-mobile-gestures/index.html#mobile-selectpickerwheelvalue[Select Picker Wheel Value], default value is `0.1`
+
+==== *_Parameters_*
+
+. `$direction` - next value to select, either `NEXT` or `PREVIOUS`
+. `$locator` - locator to locate `XCUIElementTypePickerWheel` element
+
+==== *_Usage_*
+
+.DatePicker.story
+[source,gherkin]
+----
+Scenario: Select next date in year wheell

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -475,4 +475,36 @@ When I change Appium session settings:
 |allowInvisibleElements|true |
 ----
 
+=== Select date in date picker
+
+==== *_Info_*
+
+Selects a next or previous picker wheel value in date picker
+
+[WARNING]
+Supported only for `iOS` platform
+Located by the locator element type must be `XCUIElementTypePickerWheel`
+
+==== *_Wording_*
+
+[source,gherkin]
+----
+When I select $direction value with `$offset` offset in picker wheel located `$locator`
+----
+
+==== *_Parameters_*
+
+. `$direction` - next value to select, either `NEXT` or `PREVIOUS`
+. `$offset` - offset, see https://appium.io/docs/en/writing-running-appium/ios/ios-xctest-mobile-gestures/index.html#mobile-selectpickerwheelvalue[Select Picker Wheel Value]
+. `$locator` - locator to locate `XCUIElementTypePickerWheel` element
+
+==== *_Usage_*
+
+.DatePicker.story
+[source,gherkin]
+----
+Scenario: Select next date in year wheel
+When I select next value with `0.1` offset in picker wheel located `xpath(//XCUIElementTypePickerWheel)->filter.index(3)`
+----

nodes.bodyText: baseValidations should go last in the list of fields and in the constructor parameters
mid - do not use shortenings in the docs
I believe you should reuse a part of JavascriptActions from the web plugin
alphabetical order doesn't make sense in such cases, for example: would you put password before username in some class storing credentials?
it seems it can be removed now
is it really required to mark it primary?
